intro: Centaurea heldreichii, commonly known as the Heldreich's cornflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in a composite head, consisting of both ray and disk florets. Centaurea heldreichii is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
